intro: Hieracium macranthum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium macranthum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
